chunks.zh: 现在智驾很火，那么想问下，有多少人敢用的，使用的场景有哪些？
chunks.en: Intelligent driving is very popular now, so I want to ask, how many people dare to use it, and what are the usage scenarios?

chunks.zh: 如题，我是不太放心把自己一家人的身家性命交给它
chunks.en: As the title says, I'm not comfortable entrusting the lives of my family to it.

chunks.zh: 高速天天用
chunks.en: Use it on the highway every day.

chunks.zh: 现在都管 ACC 叫智驾了😄~
chunks.en: Now they call ACC intelligent driving 😄~

chunks.zh: 不是，你用过没啊？城区智驾暂且不提，高速上用智驾直接解放双脚好么，脚能动的话，还可以动动腰，真开过车的人就知道开车最累的地方就是腰，反正我上高速必开智驾，舒适度拉满。
chunks.en: No, have you used it? Leaving aside city intelligent driving, using intelligent driving on the highway directly frees up your feet, okay? If your feet can move, you can also move your waist. People who have really driven a car know that the most tiring part of driving is the waist. Anyway, I always turn on intelligent driving when I get on the highway for maximum comfort.

chunks.zh: 都用了快十年了，各家标配的智驾就是油车时代的自适应驾驶 ACC+车道居中+主动刹车，以前油车上加钱都有，很成熟的技术，只不过新能源车时代做了些营销包装，再加上油车时代很多人不会选装这个，一直没接触过，所以换了新能源觉得基础版智能驾驶是个新事物。真正划时代的是完全智能驾驶，5 年内能大规模普及都算顺利了，和你想问的不是一个东西
chunks.en: I've been using it for almost ten years. The standard intelligent driving of each company is adaptive driving ACC + lane centering + active braking from the fuel car era. It used to be available for extra money on fuel cars. It's a very mature technology, but it has been marketed in the new energy vehicle era. Plus, many people in the fuel car era didn't choose to install this, so they never came into contact with it, so when they switched to new energy, they felt that the basic version of intelligent driving was a new thing. The truly epoch-making one is fully intelligent driving. It would be smooth if it could be widely popularized within 5 years, which is not the same thing you want to ask.

chunks.zh: 用的都是被洗脑的。觉醒者肯定不用（ fsd 除外）。
chunks.en: Those who use it are brainwashed. Awakened people definitely don't use it (except for fsd).

chunks.zh: 高速真的可以减轻驾驶疲劳。没用过的同学，不要以为“用 = 完全不管”。现在的情况是这样的：用（眼睛也盯着前方路况，出现特殊情况准备时自己接管），就这样已经能减轻很大的驾驶疲劳了。我是高度近视，以前晚上都是尽量不开车。。白天开高速超过 200 公里就感觉会腰酸，现在用智驾晚上也敢开了，甚至感觉能干个 1000 公里（虽然没试过）
chunks.en: Highways can really reduce driving fatigue. Students who haven't used it, don't think 'use = completely ignore'. The current situation is like this: use it (eyes also staring at the road conditions ahead, ready to take over in special circumstances), and this has greatly reduced driving fatigue. I have severe myopia and used to avoid driving at night as much as possible. Driving more than 200 kilometers on the highway during the day would make my back ache, but now I dare to drive at night with intelligent driving, and I even feel like I can do 1000 kilometers (although I haven't tried it).

chunks.zh: @wxw752 你不光超速违法，还刀片害人，希望你早日后果自负，已 block
chunks.en: @wxw752 You are not only speeding and breaking the law, but also endangering people with your 'blades'. I hope you will bear the consequences soon. Blocked.

chunks.zh: @wxw752 不是你高速开 150 真不是啥值的炫耀的东西...定到 130 是合理的
chunks.en: @wxw752 Driving at 150 on the highway is not something to brag about... Setting it to 130 is reasonable.

chunks.zh: 除非车企承诺出事故全额赔付再用
chunks.en: Unless the car company promises full compensation in the event of an accident, then I'll use it.

chunks.zh: 出门路况良好（行人非机动车少）都会用。这玩意儿和高速 acc 一样，使用时注意人工监督干预就好，谁也没要求你在车内睡大觉撒手不管。智驾属于用之前各种不屑无所谓，用之后真香回不去的东西。
chunks.en: I use it when the road conditions are good (few pedestrians and non-motor vehicles). This thing is the same as high-speed ACC. Just pay attention to manual supervision and intervention when using it. No one asks you to sleep in the car and let go. Intelligent driving is something that you disdain before using it, but you love and can't go back after using it.

chunks.zh: 我现在高速 70%开智驾，楼上也说了，用≠不管。开的时候精神是集中的，身体是放松的。有危险的气息我老早就接管了，几百公里下来，以前腰酸腿酸，现在轻松得很精神也好。
chunks.en: I now use intelligent driving for 70% of my highway driving. As the person above said, use ≠ ignore. When driving, my mind is focused, and my body is relaxed. I take over as soon as I sense danger. After hundreds of kilometers, my back and legs used to ache, but now I'm very relaxed and have a good spirit.

chunks.zh: “智驾”的定义本身有问题，“辅助驾驶”对老百姓描述更准确。NOA 这种点到点的驾驶肯定不会用，拿自己命在赌，也不现实，除非市场上 90% 以上的车都开启这样的功能。连 APA 自动泊车 其实使用的场景都比较少。主要是还是  ACC 自适应巡航系统配合 LCC 车道居中辅助功能，这个两个每天都在用。还有一些基本不会用到，也不希望用到的智驾功能，但是时刻在保护我们的。
chunks.en: The definition of 'intelligent driving' itself is problematic. 'Assisted driving' is a more accurate description for the average person. I will definitely not use NOA point-to-point driving, as I am betting my life. It is also not realistic unless more than 90% of the cars on the market have this function enabled. Even APA automatic parking is rarely used. It is mainly the ACC adaptive cruise control system combined with LCC lane centering assist that I use every day. There are also some intelligent driving functions that I basically never use and don't want to use, but they are always protecting us.

chunks.zh: @nuomi196500 @wxw752 你们好歹去试驾下，再不济看下视频云体验下，老式 BBA 的自适应驾驶也就能保持车道+急刹，问题是遇到障碍物你急刹停住了后面的车咋办？后面小型车也就算了，反正撞到报废也是他主责，而且是追尾，但是万一是大货车呢？你没有主动避险的功能没用啊，还有说我全程盯着的，随时掌控，你如果全程盯着你就会发现这功能没卵用，你反而更累了，还不如自己开呢，随时提心吊胆，最后保持车道功能仅适用于划线明确的路段，就现在的高速的情况，超过 300KM 的路段，100%能遇到修路的情况
chunks.en: @nuomi196500 @wxw752 You should at least go for a test drive, or at least watch a video for a cloud experience. The adaptive driving of old-fashioned BBAs can only maintain the lane + emergency braking. The problem is, what if you stop suddenly when encountering an obstacle and the car behind you crashes into you? A small car behind you is fine, anyway. If it is crashed into scrap, it is their primary responsibility, and it is a rear-end collision. But what if it is a truck? It's useless if you don't have the function of actively avoiding risks. Also, if you say you are staring at it all the time and controlling it at any time, you will find that this function is useless, and you will be more tired. It is better to drive yourself, constantly worrying. Finally, the lane keeping function is only applicable to clearly marked road sections. In the current highway conditions, you will encounter road construction on 100% of the sections exceeding 300KM.

chunks.zh: @helone #75 懒得讨论还艾特我，下次别这么干了，一点战斗力没有。
chunks.en: @helone #75 I'm too lazy to discuss it, but you still @ me. Don't do it next time. You have no fighting power at all.

chunks.zh: @wxw752 #80 换早几年，我肯定帮你找一堆实际测试的视频，现在我的看法就是，当我们开始与 xx 争论的那一刻起，其实就已经输了，你自己喜欢就好，祝好
chunks.en: @wxw752 #80 If it were a few years earlier, I would definitely help you find a bunch of actual test videos. Now my opinion is that from the moment we start arguing with xx, we have actually lost. You like it, that's good. Best wishes.

chunks.zh: @helone #95 没问题，下次别艾特我了就行。摸鱼度过难熬时光，你这种性格根本陪伴不了几分钟。自命清高没问题，那一开始就不应该发那么大一段话，还是道行不够，得克制一下
chunks.en: @helone #95 No problem, just don't @ me next time. Passing the hard time by slacking off. A personality like yours can't last a few minutes. There's no problem with being self-righteous, but you shouldn't have posted such a long paragraph in the first place. You're not skilled enough, you need to restrain yourself.

chunks.zh: @helone 第一我是油电双车主，电车开过小鹏/理想，目前开特斯拉，不需要云体验，每天都在体验，我的体验就是行驶中跟车体验完全一样。第二行业定义 ACC 是辅助驾驶的重要组成部分，你说的那些功能只能算是锦上添花，本质上还是 ACC 在发挥最核心的作用，离真正的完全自动驾驶还有很长的路要走。第三，油车 ACC 也分价位的，至少我目前开的这辆有自动变道、避让、侧向防撞、出入匝道等等。第四，我不太理解有些人作为消费者花钱买了东西，为什么无法忍受别人正常讨论和看待自己购买的东西，包括但不限于汽车手机相机等等一切，很奇怪的心态。
chunks.en: @helone First, I am a hybrid car owner. I have driven Xiaopeng/Li Auto electric cars, and currently drive a Tesla. I don't need cloud experience. I experience it every day. My experience is that the car following experience is exactly the same when driving. Second, the industry defines ACC as an important part of assisted driving. The functions you mentioned can only be regarded as icing on the cake. In essence, ACC is still playing the most core role. There is still a long way to go before true fully autonomous driving. Third, fuel car ACCs also have different prices. At least the one I am currently driving has automatic lane change, avoidance, side collision prevention, entering and exiting ramps, etc. Fourth, I don't understand why some people, as consumers, can't stand others normally discussing and viewing the things they buy, including but not limited to cars, mobile phones, cameras, etc. It's a very strange mentality.

chunks.zh: @letwewell 这种心态要不得，钱能陪，命没法赔。自己要为自己的安全负责。个人不喜欢“智驾”这个次，本身就是辅助驾驶。自动驾驶更是大忽悠。
chunks.en: @letwewell This kind of mentality is unacceptable. Money can be compensated, but life cannot. You have to be responsible for your own safety. Personally, I don't like the word 'intelligent driving'. It is essentially assisted driving. Autonomous driving is even more of a scam.

chunks.zh: @iwantcomputer 你这个理解不准确。LCC 和智驾最大差别是车是否知道你想去哪里。L2 辅助驾驶也就是自适应巡航+车道保持早就普及了。
chunks.en: @iwantcomputer Your understanding is inaccurate. The biggest difference between LCC and intelligent driving is whether the car knows where you want to go. L2 assisted driving, that is, adaptive cruise + lane keeping, has already been popularized.

chunks.zh: 国内大车企的 L2 辅助驾驶放心用，国外（沃尔沃、丰田、宝马等）一切智驾包括辅助驾驶一概不用，信不过。
chunks.en: Feel free to use L2 assisted driving from major domestic car companies, but I don't trust any intelligent driving, including assisted driving, from foreign countries (Volvo, Toyota, BMW, etc.).
